name: Tar Golem
description: The Tar Golem embodies the raw, sticky nature of tar, serving as a formidable adversary in combat. It is a large, amorphous creature with a gooey exterior that can burn and poison those who come too close.
memorable: The Golem ignites when taking fire damage and emits poisonous smoke while burning, providing unique area control and intimidation.
goals: To serve as a relentless combatant and protect its creator, engaging in direct melee encounters.
relations: May be created or controlled by powerful spellcasters or alchemists, often found with other constructs.
environment: Typically found in volcanic areas or regions with abundant natural tar or oil.
strengths: Immunities to fire, poison, psychic damage, and non-magical physical attacks except those made with adamantine weapons; also has magic resistance.
weaknesses: Vulnerable to cold damage, which can significantly impair its function.
attacks: Performs strong Slam melee attacks dealing significant bludgeoning damage, with the ability to create additional fire damage when ignited.
most_powerful_ability: The Fire Hazard ability allows the golem to burst into flames upon taking fire damage, causing area damage to nearby creatures.
senses: Has darkvision and a passive perception of 10.
skills: Limited perception skill, as indicated by a passive perception score of 10.
additional_information: Functions without the need for air, food, drink, or sleep.
Can absorb nearby non-magical fire, activating its fire hazard.
Has a unique ability to regain hit points when subjected to fire while paralyzed.
Weapon attacks are treated as magical to overcome damage resistances.
Can traverse difficult surfaces and ceilings easily.
test_queries: sticky golem that ignites in fire
poisonous golem that can climb surfaces
construct creature vulnerable to cold damage
golem that emits noxious smoke when burning
medium-sized golem with strong slam attacks
